name: Bleeding
effect: Accumulates. The target takes damage at the end of its turn equal to its bleeding amount, then loses one level of bleeding.
recovery: Alleviated by resting, healing spells, or the "help" action.
notes: Monsters not composed of living flesh are immune.

name: Blinded
effect: The target cannot see, has disadvantage on attack rolls, and automatically fails any ability checks and saving throws based on sight.
recovery: {{items.antidote}}, or wait until vision returns naturally.
notes: Characters that use echolocation or magical sight are immune to this condition.

name: Burning
effect: Accumulates. Characters take 1d4 damage at the end of their turn, then lose one level of burning. If accumulated burning exceeds the target's {{attr.STR}} score at the start of their turn, they are incapacitated for that turn.
recovery: Alleviated by freezing, water, or the Fire Mitigation ability.
notes: Enemies immune to burning damage are also immune to this condition.

name: Deafened
effect: The target cannot hear, and automatically fails ability checks and saving throws based on hearing.
causes: Poisons or loud sounds and explosions.
notes: If the target navigates via echolocation, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls.

name: Incapacitated
effect: The target cannot take actions or reactions, and automatically fails ability checks and saving throws. DC is reduced to zero.

name: Intoxicated
effect: Accumulates. Reduces {{attr.DEX}} and {{attr.INT}} by 1 for every level. The target becomes incapacitated and falls unconscious for 1d4 hours when intoxication level exceeds {{attr.STR}} score.
causes: Inflicted by alcohol and certain drugs or poisons.
recovery: One level of intoxication is lost per hour.

name: Terrified
effect: Terrified beyond rational measure, the target is compelled to take the move away from the source of its fear each turn before taking any other actions.
causes: Fear spells, and the roar of a barbarian.

name: Dazed
effect: The target cannot take reactions, and has disadvantage on all ability checks.
causes: Blows to the head, poisoning, or confusion spells.

name: Prone
effect: The target cannot move or take actions that require both hands. DC is reduced by half. Ranged attacks against prone creatures have disadvantage.
causes: Force damage and various martial abilities.
recovery: Use the move action to stand up.
notes: Standing from the prone position costs one half of remaining movement points.

name: Lethargic
effect: The target must expend willpower to take the move action. All willpower is exhuasted if traveling more than one mile on foot. The target also has disadvantage on skill checks and saving throws.
notes: Typically not inflicted during combat, since diseases take an hour or to so to take hold.

name: Madness
effect: Temporarily insane, the target no longer speaks or acts coherently. Their {{attr.INT}} and {{attr.CHA}} scores are reduced by half, and their speech comes out as incoherent babbling. The target must also make a DT 18 {{attr.NST}} saving throw or else immediately attack the nearest creature. Unless otherwise specified, the target may attempt a DT 15 {{attr.NST}] saving throw at the end of its turn to end the effect.
causes: Certain forms of magic or poisons.

name: Restrained
effect: The target cannot move and their DC is reduced by half. They also have disadvantage when making melee and ranged attacks.
causes: Ropes, nets, spiderwebs, or entangling vines or tentacles.
recovery: Receiving help from an ally or taking {{damage.slashing}} or {{damage.heat}} damage.
notes: Vines and webbing can typically be rent by passing a DT 14 {{attr.STR}} saving throw, ending the effect.

name: Freezing
effect: Accumulates. The target's {{attr.DEX}} is reduced by 1 for each turn of accumulated freezing. Accumulated freezing decreases by 1 at the end of every turn.
notes: Progresses to frozen when total freezing exceeds the target's {{attr.STR}} score.

name: Frozen
effect: The target is encased in ice and incapacitated. They become vulnerable to {{damage.force}} and {{damage.bludgeoning}}, but resistant to all other forms of damage.
notes: End burning and pauses poisoned and bleeding status effects.

name: Petrified
effect: The target is incapacitated and becomes vulnerable to {{damage.force}} and {{damage.bludgeoning}}, but immune to all other forms of damage.
causes: Petrification spells, or gazing upon a Gorgon.
notes: Ends burning and pauses poisoned and bleeding status effects.

name: Poisoned
effect: After a set amount of time, the poison takes hold. The exact effect depends on the type of poison.
causes: Alchemical or biological toxins, or necromantic spells.
recovery: Taking an {{items.antidote}} or a long rest.
notes: Monsters not composed of living flesh are immune.

name: Levitated
effect: The target is levitating, unable to plant their feet firmly on the ground. The target cannot move by mundane means, or make melee attacks.

name: Invisibility
effect: The target cannot be seen or detected via light sources, including magical light sources. The target has advantage when attempting to hide or make melee attacks. Enemies attempting to make melee or ranged attacks against the target have disadvantage.

name: Ephemeral Invisibility
effect: A fragile form of invisibility that dispels at anything more than a slight touch. When interacting with objects (such a handling a bow or opening a door), the target must make a DT 16 {{attr.DEX}} saving throw or lose invisibility. The target also loses invisibility after making a melee attack or being attacked. The target otherwise gains all the benefits of true invisibility.
